Graph class.
\index{Graph (class in cosifer.collections.graph)@\spxentry{Graph}\spxextra{class in cosifer.collections.graph}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{_modules/cosifer.collections:cosifer.collections.graph.Graph}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cosifer.collections.graph.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Graph}}}{\emph{adjacency}, \emph{labels=None}, \emph{undirected=True}}{}
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

Lightweight class for handling cosifer graph objects.
If the graph is undirected the adjacency matrix is stored as a sparse
lower triangular matrix.

\index{directed\_to\_undirected\_interactions() (in module cosifer.collections.interaction\_table)@\spxentry{directed\_to\_undirected\_interactions()}\spxextra{in module cosifer.collections.interaction\_table}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{_modules/cosifer.collections:cosifer.collections.interaction_table.directed_to_undirected_interactions}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cosifer.collections.interaction\_table.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{directed\_to\_undirected\_interactions}}}{\emph{directed\_interactions}}{}
Processing of a directed table, discarding directions and keeping only
the maximum edge value. It will drop and reindex with integers the table.
:param: directed\_interactions: directed interactions table.
:return: an undirected version of the given table.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{directed\_interactions}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.DataFrame}}) \textendash{} directed interactions dataframe.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
undirected interactions dataframe

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
pd.DataFrame

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{interaction\_dictionary}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}) \textendash{} an interaction dictionary.
The dictionary should contain two keys: ‘labels’, containing the
node labels, and ‘interactions’, an object that can be used to
construct a dataframe representing the edge list.

\index{sort\_interaction\_entities() (in module cosifer.inferencers.funchisq)@\spxentry{sort\_interaction\_entities()}\spxextra{in module cosifer.inferencers.funchisq}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{_modules/cosifer.inferencers:cosifer.inferencers.funchisq.sort_interaction_entities}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cosifer.inferencers.funchisq.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{sort\_interaction\_entities}}}{\emph{row}}{}
Sort the entities over a row in lexicographic order.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{row}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.Series}}) \textendash{} row containing the entities to be sorted.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\begin{description}
\item[{a list containing the sorted entities and the rest of the}] \leavevmode
elements of the row unchanged.

\end{description}


\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsubsection{Module contents}
\label{\detokenize{_modules/cosifer.inferencers:module-cosifer.inferencers}}\label{\detokenize{_modules/cosifer.inferencers:module-contents}}\index{cosifer.inferencers (module)@\spxentry{cosifer.inferencers}\spxextra{module}}
Inferencer module.

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{_modules/cosifer.utils:cosifer.utils.stats.bonferroni_correction}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cosifer.utils.stats.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{bonferroni\_correction}}}{\emph{p\_values}, \emph{q\_star}}{}

at given significance level with a Bonferroni correction.
Used implementation robust to nan values through statsmodels.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p\_values}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{iterable}}) \textendash{} p-values to be used for correction.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{q\_star}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} false discovery rate.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
indices of significant p-values.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}
